required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dose Escalation Trial of CM310 in Patients With Moderate-to-Severe Atopic Dermatitis (AD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo-controlled, Multiple Dose Escalation, Phase Ib/IIa Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerance, PK, PD, Immunogenicity and Preliminary Efficacy of Subcutaneously CM310 in Moderate-severe AD Subjects.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, randomized, double blind, placebo-controlled multiple dose escalation study to evaluate the safety, tolerance, PK, PD, immunogenicity and preliminary efficacy of subcutaneously CM310 in moderate-severe AD subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: The study consists of 3 periods, a up-to-4-week Screening Period, a 4-week randomized Treatment Period and a 8-week Safety Follow-up Period.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Safety parameters (e.g., Incidence of AE, abnormal physical examinations, abnormal vital signs, abnormal ECG, and abnormal lab testing)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of AE, abnormal physical examinations, abnormal vital signs, abnormal ECG, and abnormal lab testing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics parameter: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 0 to ∞ (AUC0-∞)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 0 to ∞ (AUC0-∞)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics parameter: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 0 to t (AUC0-t)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 0 to t (AUC0-t)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamics parameters: Serum Thymus and activation regulated chemokine (TARC)
secondary_outcome.description: Serum Thymus and activation regulated chemokine (TARC), total IgE level and blood eosinophil count (EOS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity: Proportion of subjects with anti-drug antibody (ADA)
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of Participants with anti-drug antibody (ADA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Preliminary efficacy: Proportion of subjects with IGA 0 or 1
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with Investigator's Global Assessment (IGA, on a 6-point scale, range from 0-5 point, higher scores mean a worse disease severity) 0 or 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Preliminary efficacy: Proportion of subjects with a reduction of IGA from baseline of ≥ 2 points
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with a reduction of IGA from baseline of ≥ 2 points

secondary_outcome.measure: Preliminary efficacy: Proportion of subjects with IGA 0 or 1 and a reduction of IGA from baseline of ≥ 2 points
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with IGA 0 or 1 and a reduction of IGA from baseline of ≥ 2 points

secondary_outcome.measure: Preliminary efficacy: Proportion of subjects with EASI-50
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with The Eczema Area and Severity Index(EASI)-50 (≥50 percent improvement from baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: Preliminary efficacy: Proportion of subjects with EASI-75
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with EASI-75 (≥75 percent improvement from baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: Preliminary efficacy: Proportion of subjects with improvement (reduction) of pruritus NRS from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with improvement (reduction) of pruritus Numerical Rating Scale(NRS) from baseline; The range of NRS is from 0 (no itch)-10 (worst imaginable itch)

arm_group.description: 600mg for 1st dose, and then 300 mg for 2nd and 3rd doses, every 2 weeks, SC
placebo for 3 doses, every 2 weeks, SC

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed as AD for at least 12 months before Screening, with below requirements: 1)EASI score ≥16 at Screening and Baseline; 2) IGA score ≥3 (0-5 points scale) at Screening and Baseline; 3) ≥10% BSA of AD involvement at Screening and Baseline; 4) Pruritus NRS average score ≥3 at Baseline.
- Inadequate response to topical medications.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not enough washing-out period for previous therapy.
- Concurrent disease/status which may potentially affect the efficacy/safety judgement.
- Organ dysfunction.
- Pregnancy.
- Other.

facility.name: Second Xiangya Hospital of Central South University
West China Hospital of Sichuan University
